concept.title: Platform-Specific Functions
concept.shortdesc: Explains how bootstrap functions are organised.

conbody.p: Platform-specific source code needs to implement a set of standard functions that are called by the generic source code. It also needs to provide a set of standard MMU permission and cache attribute definitions.
Standard functions are organised in the following way:

li.p: a set of public functions that the Symbian platform generic source links to directly
a set of functions that are contained in a table, known as the boot table.

conbody.p: Refer to the Template bootstrap source code: os/kernelhwsrv/bsptemplate/asspandvariant/template_variant/bootstrap/template.s
conbody.note: All bootstrap source code should be position independent.
